docs.abstract: The budget carrier was challenged by rising competition, Brexit and more recently the spread of coronavirus, and had sought government help.
docs.snippet: The budget carrier was challenged by rising competition, Brexit and more recently the spread of coronavirus, and had sought government help.
docs.lead_paragraph: Flybe, an ailing regional airline in Britain that was praised for flying into underserved corners of the country, ceased operations on Thursday after financial strains caused by coronavirus.

headline.main: Flybe, a British Regional Airline, Stops Flying
headline.print_headline: Budget Airline Serving Britain Is Shut Down By Coronavirus

byline.original: By Iliana Magra and Carlos Tejada

docs.abstract: Some who own or charter superyachts want to take them on adventures, but the risks are high and insurers are balking.
docs.snippet: Some who own or charter superyachts want to take them on adventures, but the risks are high and insurers are balking.
docs.lead_paragraph: Yachts — the mere word connotes luxury and easy living. They are a symbol of wealth second only to private jets.

headline.main: Yachts Are for More Than Lounging

docs.abstract: President Trump and others have asked if halting normal life and commerce to fight the coronavirus is worth the cost. Here’s how economists figure it.
docs.snippet: President Trump and others have asked if halting normal life and commerce to fight the coronavirus is worth the cost. Here’s how economists figure it.
docs.lead_paragraph: Can we measure the cost of hundreds of thousands of dead?

headline.main: Shutdown Spotlights Economic Cost of Saving Lives
headline.print_headline: Hard Math:  Economic Costs  Of Saving Lives

byline.original: By Eduardo Porter and Jim Tankersley

docs.abstract: Readers want to know how the virus outbreak will affect their personal finances. We have answers.
docs.snippet: Readers want to know how the virus outbreak will affect their personal finances. We have answers.
docs.lead_paragraph: You might be asking yourself lately: “Should I stop contributing to my 401(k)?” Lots of people are.

headline.main: Amid Coronavirus Anxiety, Should I Stop Making 401(k) Contributions?

docs.abstract: The shale drilling peak of a decade ago may never return, but the coronavirus fallout is being taken in stride: “Everyone knows oil is boom and bust.”
docs.snippet: The shale drilling peak of a decade ago may never return, but the coronavirus fallout is being taken in stride: “Everyone knows oil is boom and bust.”
docs.lead_paragraph: KARNES CITY, Texas — Leaner days are back in the oil patch of South Texas.

headline.main: In a Texas Oil Town, Pain but No Panic as Prices Crash
headline.print_headline: Once-Booming Oil Town in Texas Braces for a Bust as Prices Crash

docs.abstract: The giant oil producer’s earnings statement for 2019 provides a bleak backdrop for 2020, as prices have collapsed following the coronavirus outbreak.
docs.snippet: The giant oil producer’s earnings statement for 2019 provides a bleak backdrop for 2020, as prices have collapsed following the coronavirus outbreak.
docs.lead_paragraph: Saudi Aramco, the world’s largest oil company, said on Sunday that its profit last year fell more than 20 percent, primarily because of lower oil prices.

headline.main: Saudi Aramco’s Profits Slip as Oil Prices Fall

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

docs.abstract: Central banks are reopening the 2008 crisis playbook as the coronavirus brings the economy to a halt. But fighting a pandemic isn’t the same as a mortgage meltdown.
docs.snippet: Central banks are reopening the 2008 crisis playbook as the coronavirus brings the economy to a halt. But fighting a pandemic isn’t the same as a mortgage meltdown.
docs.lead_paragraph: There is a lot of worry out there. We will get through this, but acting now and genuinely practicing social distancing matters. As Dr. Mukesh Prasad of Weill Cornell Medicine in New York told DealBook: “If this battle ends up being fought in the hospital, we have lost.” Dr. Prasad added: “Come together, care for those vulnerable in the herd, and survive. Every one of us has a role.” (Want this in your inbox each morning? Sign up here.)

headline.main: A Big Bet That May Not Be Enough

docs.lead_paragraph: This briefing is no longer updating. Read the latest developments in the coronavirus outbreak here.

docs.abstract: A small change to tax policy could hand $170 billion in tax savings to real estate tycoons.
docs.snippet: A small change to tax policy could hand $170 billion in tax savings to real estate tycoons.
docs.lead_paragraph: The federal government’s planned $2 trillion economic rescue package includes financial aid for individuals and industries that are struggling to survive the coronavirus pandemic.

headline.main: Bonanza for Rich Real Estate Investors, Tucked Into Stimulus Package
headline.print_headline: Real Estate Investors Poised To Get Boon in Stimulus Bill

docs.abstract: Home-cooked lunches and no commuting while we deal with coronavirus can’t compensate for what’s lost in creativity.
docs.snippet: Home-cooked lunches and no commuting while we deal with coronavirus can’t compensate for what’s lost in creativity.
docs.lead_paragraph: I’m writing this from the makeshift quarantine bunker in my dining room — sweatpants on, hand sanitizer nearby, snacking my way through my emergency rations. I’m getting plenty of work done, but I’m starting to get unnerved by the lack of stimulation. It’s been hours (days?) since I interacted face to face with a human who is not related to me, and cabin fever is setting in.

headline.main: Sorry, but Working From Home Is Overrated
